Note that your objective in each level is to kill every enemy; since the levels have multiple paths, you will need to backtrack often.
title: Soul Fighter

description:
A life simulation which shows how organisms evolve. Take control of one of life's earliest lifeforms and, depending on what environment and habitat you prefer to use, watch as your organism starts to evolve and adapt to its surroundings.

You control your organism from a third person perspective and you can choose what it feeds on and how it kills its prey and, depending on the method you choose, your organism will evolve to make killing and eating that kind of prey easier.

sample_screenshots.caption: After swimming around and eating for a while, you grow into this form, which can attack and equip body parts
The next screen shows an overview of the unlocked body parts
The second area is a big underwater cave

title: Seventh Cross: Evolution

description:
In addition to the gameplay of Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo, known as mode X, this game features:

  • 2 new gameplay modes Y and Z, which are variations of the rules in mode X
  • An expert difficulty level
  • A Counter Gem editor which allows you to create custom attack patterns
  • EX Options where you can edit the game play rules
  • An online Vs mode

In Y and Z modes each diamond piece is a specific color, unlike mode X where a diamond embodies all colors.

In mode Y you fill a meter by placing gems of the same color together and destroying them with a crash gem of the same color. When your meter is full you can summon a diamond whose color is determined by the character you selected. The diamond has different effects depending on what kind of gem it is placed on.

In mode Z diamonds will destroy all normal and numbered gems of the same color.

The servers for the online Vs mode of the game shutdown on September 1, 2003.
title: Super Puzzle Fighter II X for Matching Service

description:
Another remake of the classic RPG Sorcerian this time exclusive to the SEGA Dreamcast. Once again you must take control of a party of 4 player-created adventurers and lead them through 10 scenarios from the original game and 5 new ones specially designed for this version in a side-scrolling fashion, each featuring a unique stand-alone quest for you to complete.

The remake features for the first time in a Sorcerian game a fully polygonal engine, even if the game plays like a side-scroller while in the dungeons and from a top-down perspective in the town. Also included are new items, spells and job classes for your characters and the ability to enchant items and create your own spells while in town.
title: Sorcerian: Shichisei Mahō no Shito

description:
Puyo Puyo Da! is a rhythm-action game set in the Puyo Puyo universe. The main characters of the series decide to take a break from all the spellcasting and puyo catching by competing against each other in a series of dance-offs.

Each player receives a sequence of controller motions and tries to perform said sequence matching the graphic and audio cues that play out. Success increases your health bar, but if you fail you run the risk of getting beaten by your opponent.

Graphics are completely 3D for the first time in a Puyo Puyo game, featuring fully polygonal models of each character as they dance in sync with the music, composed of an assorted variety of J-Pop tunes.
title: Puyo Puyo Da!

description:
The agreement between the Earth Council and the Haak Delegates came about, not through political or military means, but by financial measures. Three years after their mother-ship first orbited the earth the Haak were invited to the surface in peace and in the search for mutual rewards.

This agreement has been upheld for 7 years with only the occasional backlash causing small localised human/Haak conflict but the Haak have kept up their end of the bargain - until now.

We have started to lose contact with the human installations around the Haak settlements. The first three recon forces sent to investigate the disturbances were shot out of the air. The Red Dog Tactical Response Team is now preparing for war.

As commander of the Red Dog assault vehicle, your job is to rid our people of the now aggressive Haak forces currently occupying the continents of planet earth. Good Luck - Don't dent the tank!
title: Red Dog: Superior Firepower

description:
World Series Baseball 2K1 features the actual players, teams, and stadiums of the 2000 baseball season. You can play an exhibition game or a season of 13-162 games, including an All-Star game and play-offs.

Gameplay is the standard behind-the-catcher viewpoint for batting and pitching, switching to different views after the ball is hit. The game's limitation is the inability to control the fielders until after the ball is fielded.
title: World Series Baseball 2K1

description: NCAA College Football 2K2 is a college football game featuring several gameplay modes. Play an exhibition game, play a complete season hopefully culminating in the Rose Bowl, or follow your favorite team for several years in Legacy mode. The game features online play as well as user-created players, teams, and plays.
title: NCAA College Football 2K2: Road to the Rose Bowl

description:
Ice hockey featuring all 28 NHL teams, rosters, and arenas from the 1999-2000 season.

Play an exhibition game or play through an 82-game season, including the All-Star Game, culminating in the playoffs where you vie for the Stanley Cup.

You can also trade players as the GM and create up to 40 players.
title: NHL 2K

description:
Blending the stealth, RTS, and RPG genres, Industrial Spy has the player leading a team of superspies (Espion Agents, part of the Blitzstrahl corporation) infiltrating various locales like museums, a military installation, and even a German-style castle full of traps. Each of the agents has his own specialties, like computer hacking, rollerblading, handguns, etc.

Gameplay is like a regular real-time strategy game, with the player acting in the role of commander without taking a direct hand in anything. Give the agents orders and try to keep an eye on all of them as they carry them out. Each agent's skills can be upgraded after missions. Keep them out of sight of guards, spring traps on them, or engage them in hand-to-hand or ranged combat.
title: Industrial Spy: Operation Espionage

description: This game is an upgrade to Sega Worldwide Soccer 2000, with an improved graphical engine and the possibility to let you play the Euro 2000 celebrated in Holland and Belgium. Other available game modes are the World Cup (where you could compete as any of the 64 best teams in the world), National leagues (Italian, Spanish, English, German, Japanese, etc), International leagues and friendly match. Regarding player licenses, this game takes the same position as World League Soccer 98; that is, player names will resemble those of their real life counterparts, but will not be exactly the same (although curiously, game commentators will pronounce them correctly).
title: Sega Worldwide Soccer 2000: Euro Edition

description:
In Godzilla Generations you play as either Godzilla or Mechagodzilla and have to rage havoc in the city and fend of the army before time runs out.

You can unlock other monsters such as First Generation Godzilla, USA Godzilla and Minira by playing through the game. There are five cities that you can lay to ashes, all located in Japan. Each city has two stages to play through.

Each monster has a range of moves which range from swiping his tail, using his claws or shooting rays from his eyes or hands. Each monster can also heal himself.
title: Godzilla Generations

description:
F1 World Grand Prix II is a game for the Dreamcast. Unlike its namesake for the Nintendo 64 it features the '99 season instead of the '98 season. The game includes sixteen official tracks and all the racers and teams that come with the FIA license. The Dreamcast version features improved graphics over the Nintendo 64 original.

The game allows you to fine-tune your car to your own preferences and features Exhibition play, Grand Prix, Time Attack, Challenge and Match Race. You can tweak the settings of your car before each race and the game features various types of weather. The cars feature realistic damage models.
title: F1 World Grand Prix II

description:
An island in the sky, Shunkashu Island, is a place of everlasting spring where people live peacefully together with androids and spirits. But recently, snow has started to fall on Shunkashu Island. It must be the work of the Snow Family, but what reason would they have to do such a thing? Spring must return to Shunkashu Island, and for that reason the fight is beginning: The Great Snow War.

Daisessen is a strategy game very similar to the board game classic Battleship. Two players arrange soldiers on a grid, then take turns firing at the other team, attempting to destroy their forces first. The game has a story mode and a 2-player versus mode, and also supported online play.
title: Tsūshin Taisen Logic Battle Daisessen

description:
The Shikigami No Shiro II Deluxe Edition includes the following items:* Castle Shikigami 2

  • A soundtrack CD
  • Trading cards
  • A telephone card (Sega Direct release only)
title: Castle Shikigami 2 (Deluxe Edition)

description:
The king has gotten lost looking for his daughter, so a golem sets out on a journey to find him and help him out. The Lost Golem is a puzzle game where the player must guide the king to a door in each stage by pushing walls around. Each stage is made up of walls, gates, and holes. The king will walk straight forward at all times, and turn whenever he runs into a wall. Walls will move in different ways depending on the gates they are connected to, either rotating around a gate or moving forward one space.

In addition to guiding the king to the goal, the player must also ensure that a certain number of walls are connected to a specific wall, which glows red, by the gates. If the king falls in a hole or gets squished between two walls, or if the wrong number of walls are connected at the end of the stage, the stage is lost and must be tried again.

Cutscenes are interspersed throughout the game, which tell the story in sequences of still images and text. The game also includes a stage editor where you can create your own puzzles.
title: Golem no Maigo

description:
SEGA Bass Fishing 2 is the obvious sequel to SEGA Bass Fishing. Like the previous game in the series this simulation game allows the player to fish for bass on various lakes. At the start of the game the player can pick one of various characters. Each character has his or her own stats such as casting distance, which makes them all unique. Each character's appearance can be altered by the player as well.

Using sonar the player can cruise around the lake until he find a good fishing spot. Besides the location the player can also pick the month, time of day and weather in which he wants to fish. All these factors are calculated when it comes to determining what kind of fish he or she is likely to catch. To aid the player there's 100 different kinds of lures to fish with.

The game is meant to be played with the special fishing rod controller.

There are two game modes: free fishing and tournament mode. In the first you can do what you wish and try to improve on your own records. In the latter mode you have to compete against NPCs or another player. There are various tiers of difficulty.
title: SEGA Bass Fishing 2

description: Idol Star Seeker Remix is the first independent release from developer G.rev Ltd., the game differs quite a bit from the company's later games. It's a fast-paced puzzle game inspired by Minesweeper and is played on a hexagonal grid. The title was undertaken on a short development cycle and budget, but tried to compensate for these flaws through using the appeal of well-endowed anime girls in provocative poses.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the story mode's dialog scenes. Happy birthday, Moe.
A tasteless reward for a job well done
A later stage with a complex puzzle

title: Doki Doki Idol Star Seeker Remix

description:
DUX is a scrolling shooter in the vein of R-Type. When scientists searched for new materials to enhance their space ships, they discovered a new and powerful material they dubbed DUX. Since this type of material proved unstable, nobody except the player seemed brave enough to fly the space ship constructed from it. The player's job is to lead the ship through a series of horizontal levels against the Spiritual Spacers "to reach the obvious."

The player's ship has a standard laser shot that can be upgraded or changed for x-ray and bounce shots, which are very similar to the weapons in R-Type. The player also has a pod that protects them from enemy bullets and that can be launched as an offensive weapon in a move called "dash." Keeping the fire button pressed will launch a more powerful hyper shot.

To score points, the player can destroy chains of enemies in quick succession or soak up chains of bullets. Hyper Soaking makes the player invulnerable to bullets, but drains the Obvious Energy gauge if not enough bullets are soaked in or new energy orbs are picked up. The player wins the game if they manage to beat all the bosses at the end of each level. If they are hit by a bullet or collide with their surroundings, a life is lost. After all lives and continues are depleted, the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: If you do not start the game, you are getting shown some playing techniques.
The bouncing lasers don't look so impressive against this flood of yellow bullets.
A narrow passage with two cannons at each end

title: DUX

description:
Charge 'N Blast is a shooting game where you play as one of three marines who have to rid the earth of alien scum. The gameplay is similar to Cabal, you move left and right dodging enemies while charging up you weapons to blast them away.

There are three different marines you can choose from, each with their own set of weapons. As usual there is the balanced character (Johnny Rock), a weaker but faster one (Pamela Hewitt) and a slower but stronger one (Nicholas Woods).

You can choose to play in one player mode, time attack or two player mode. The missions are broken up into small areas where you have to kill all enemies before moving on to the next area. Each mission ends with a boss character such as a giant insect or a Godzilla-like monster.

Use the X, Y or B buttons to choose a weapon, press A to charge and shoot and aim with analog stick. There are different types of weapons that can be used on the different types of enemies. For example the single missiles for far away targets and torpedoes for underwater enemies.

You can fire your weapon continuously, but this doesn't do as much damage compared to a fully charged shot. Charging each shot means you have to aim a little more carefully, but you'll especially need this in the later levels. You can dodge enemies with the L and R buttons.
title: Charge 'n Blast

description: The Dreamcast port of the first game in the long-running Rainbow Six series of tactical shooters includes both the original game and its add-on Eagle Watch.
title: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six

description:
This limited edition includes:

  • Shenmue
  • Bonus CD with music from the game
title: Shenmue (Limited Edition)

description:
Lack of Love (or L.O.L.) can be considered a genre-defying game, though it has strong elements of adventure (problem-solving based on exploration) and RPG (character growth and management). The game's unusual premise is the evolution of an alien being. In the beginning the player takes control of a tiny, newborn creature. The alien world is harsh, so the "hero" has to constantly improve, learn new things and avoid being eaten by other animals. To make the new life even harder, an alien robot race just discovered the planet and starts colonizing it. Surviving is obviously not easy...

The game is played from a third-person perspective with pre-rendered backgrounds. Since the protagonist is an animal, the game doesn't have any ingame texts; for solving riddles the player is totally dependent on experimentation and careful observation of the environment. To reach the next state of evolution the player will also need to help other beings - as a reward they will give the controlled creature energy balls or new abilities required for further progress.

Besides the usual actions like attacking, biting, and talking (or, better to say, communicating) the creature can perform somewhat strange actions such as sleeping and urinating, which are essential to the gameplay.
title: L.O.L.: Lack of Love

description:
Irides: Master of Blocks is a puzzle action game that is based on the concept of falling blocks, much like the famous games Tetris and Lumines.

In Irides the player's goal is to arrange four or more equally colored blocks next to each other. These squares will be continuously deleted from the play field in exchange for points.

Irides features an exciting campaign with 28 carefully designed, individual levels. Each level has its own specific mission or challenge. The player is required to simply score a certain number of points, delete a certain number of squares, clear the play field from already existing squares, battle against time or recreate a shape of squares on the play field. In addition, the player can unlock four carefully hidden bonus levels, with more, secret challenges.

An important aspect of Irides are the more than 15 individual powerups. Most of these special squares can be used to your advantage and help you complete your specific mission. There are bomb squares, squares that delete a certain color, or drill a hole in the playfield, as well as squares that have to be deleted more then once, in order for them to disappear from the field.

Irides is also OpenFeint enabled. Allowing players to challenge their friends for the highest score, interact with other players and friends in chat rooms or unlock achievements.

On top of that, Irides features some 30 minutes of music and sound effects, specifically designed for the game.
title: Irides: Master of Blocks

alternate_titles.title: Coaster Works: Build The Ride of Your Life

description:
Coaster Works puts the player in the role of a roller coaster engineer, recently hired to help construct several different roller coasters for different amusement parks.

The construction part is set up with a screen divided in four camera angles and a grid based building tool. Using vector pieces, the player has to make a roller coaster that meets the requirements of the specific park. The pieces can be tilted, elevated, lowered and turned to make sure the ride is as exciting as possible.

After the roller coaster is done it will be tested with a crash test dummy (who's also able to squeal like an excited kid), to make sure it meets such requirements as safety, speed, excitement etc. This is done in a 1st person view, allowing the player to come along for the ride as well.

There are 6 different stages, each with different sizes and limitations.
title: Coaster Works

description: Sonic Adventure: Limited Edition is a demonstration version of Sonic Adventure that was made available exclusively for rental through Hollywood Video prior to the Dreamcast's North American launch. The complete game is playable, along with full English voice acting, but saving and and all online options are disabled.
title: Sonic Adventure: Limited Edition

description:
Godzilla Generations: Maximum Impact is a sequel to the Dreamcast launch title Godzilla Generations. Both are based on the famous Japanese movies series around the eponymous Godzilla, a giant dinosaur-like monster.

The game is a rail shooter like the famed Panzer Dragoon, where you move on a fixed path but can shoot in all directions to take down waves of approaching enemies. The game also features a dodge and a lock-on mechanic. The gameplay is divided in two kinds of levels. The first style features Godzilla rampaging through a Japanese city and taking down all kinds of military devices which try to stop him. The second kind of level is a fight between Godzilla and other giant monsters from the various films.
title: Godzilla Generations: Maximum Impact

description:
90 minutes is a traditional action football game, featuring 7 leagues (England, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, plus an assortment of clubs from around the world) and national teams. While there are no team licenses, most players feature real names and there's also a player and team editor, allowing to change name and number of players, who's in each national team, as well as creating teams from scratch, including its players.

Gameplay follows the norms of the genre - A to pass, B to throw a high lob, X to shoot, Y to change players, with the triggers to perform modifiers (though passes and lob shots) and sprint, although these can all be changed in the options. The player can also assign special tactics to each direction on the d-pad to adapt quickly according to the flow of the game.

Game modes include the usual - World Championship (based on the world cup), as well as national leagues and cups (as well as a customizable cup), with secret teams waiting to be unlocked by those who win them, exhibition and training. Options are also the usual on these kind of games - change half lenght (3,5 or 10 minutes), opponent level and game speed. At gametime, players can also choose the weather, time of day, and between 10 cameras. There are six stadiums to choose from, inspired by venues such as the old Wembley Stadium, the Nou Camp or the ArenA in Amsterdam.

sample_screenshots.caption: The stands are empty in Training Mode
During the team intro the announcer says every player's name aloud.

title: 90 Minutes: Sega Championship Football

description: This is the limited edition of the game Fast Striker. While the game is the same, the limited edition features a different cover and has the soundtrack to the game included on an audio CD.
title: Fast Striker (Limited Edition)

description: This is the deluxe edition of Rush Rush Rally Racing. The edition is limited and comes in a double jewel case along with a spinecard, a soundtrack CD and several stickers. The game itself features additional secret artwork and deleted scenes.
title: Rush Rush Rally Racing (Deluxe Edition)

description:
Yukawa Moto Senmu no Otakara Sagashi (or "Former Director Yukawa's Treasure Hunt" as the title translates to) was a promotional game released by Sega where 10,000 applicants could win a prize of ¥10,000 each. To do this the players had to use clues presented on the internet (using the Orange Dreamkey CD for internet access). All that was needed to enter was to purchase the game at certain retailers for the low price of ¥980. The promotional period was between March 20 through April 11, 1999.

In the game the player is cast as Sega's former Senior Managing Director Hidekazu Yukawa, presented as a cartoon character. From a top-down perspective the player navigates between different screens and using a limited amount of digs with a shovel, Yukawa needs to find certain pieces of puzzles (all with a Dreamcast theme) to match the online hints given through the internet via the Dreamcast. If he manages to complete the correct picture, the player was eligible to enter the raffle where the prize money was at stake.

There is also a VMU mini-game included which could be downloaded to aid further in the quest and make digging for treasure faster.
title: Yukawa Moto Senmu no Otakara Sagashi

description: Memories Off: Complete is a compilation that contains both Memories Off and its prequel Memories Off: Pure. The latter can be selected as a separate scenario from the main menu. Both games contain a few re-drawn images. In addition, there is a new omake mode for the Pure scenario and a quiz mini-game.
title: Memories Off: Complete

description:
Sturmwind is a horizontally scrolling shoot'em up with 16 levels divided into seven worlds, with each of the levels concluding with a boss fight. However, the course is varied sometimes, as several levels include vertically scrolling passages, and some bosses need to be beaten in a given amount of time.

The game features three different weapons which are given from the start, but can be lost in the course of the game: whenever the ship is hit (the ship is destroyed on the third hit), the currently selected weapon is destroyed. Weapons can be regained by shooting and afterwards collecting a certain kind bonus item. Initially, the item is a score bonus, but once shot, it transforms into a weapon upgrade, further shots will alter the kind of weapon which will be upgraded. A lost weapon can be recovered by collecting the corresponding upgrade, any further improvement by collecting more upgrade requires the weapon be selected. Apart from upgrades, the direction of firing can be switched from forwards to backwards, and another fire mode allows to save up energy for devastating, R-Type-inspired beam.

A number of bonuses like art galleries can be unlocked, and Sturmwind also features a number of achievements like completing any level with only using a certain weapon. Highscores can be entered on a website for comparison by entering a code given by the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fighting fire tendrils that rise up from the pit
Flying through a tube set piece
More action from the opening cinematic

title: Sturmwind

description:
DUX 1.5 is an overhauled version of the shoot'em up DUX. In comparison to the original version, it features:

  • a new soundtrack;
  • instant respawn after loosing a life (instead of being set back to the latest activated checkpoint);
  • custom controls;
  • modified gameplay, aimed at a better balancing.
title: DUX: Version 1.5

description:
Kei is a computer engineer. One day he walks into an internet bar. As he is checking his e-mails, he notices an unknown e-mail with an attachment. That takes him to a site called "Cat's Eyes". There he sees a movie of a man being killed. Not giving it a second though, he dismisses that as a game to pass time. Next day, he sees the exact same murder on the TV news.

Most of the game is happening on a fictional OS desktop where you can further access pre-defined set of applications. Web lets you access 18 different web channels with over 150 home pages which contain various things and mini-games, some to move the story forward, some just to create more believable atmosphere. Mail system keeps all the received e-mails notifying you of new ones and those you read, with ability to delete them if you wish. Data application consists of files and movies. It lets you watch all the movies you have seen so far. The remaining applications are more system oriented, config lets you change game configuration (field, speed, sound, and screen), and the file application is used to save or load a savegame file.
title: Web Mystery: Yochimu wo Miru Neko

description:
Dream Passport 3 is the next iteration in web browser for Sega Dreamcast console with various updated and new options. There is also new chat included which allows you to chat anywhere (for example with the people looking at the same page). MPEG file playback function has also been added, but there is limitation to file size that can be played.

This GD-ROM comes with several pre-installed software that is bootable from the disc.

  • Guruguru Onsen Puchi - trial version
  • DreamFlyerLight
  • Columns - with 15min time limit
  • Oomakai Mura
  • Flicky - with 15min time limit
  • Pengo - with 15min time limit
  • Puyo Puyo - with 15min time limit
  • Dream Library
  • Dream Passport 2 startup
title: Dream Passport 3

description:
Limited Edition package contains:

  • Under Defeat game
  • Under Defeat: Extended Tracks soundtrack
title: Under Defeat (Genteiban)

description:
Dreamcast version of Pandora no Yume is a PC port of Pandora no Yume which additionally includes new CG events for each of the heroines and fan disk sequel scenarios for each of the characters which are integrated in the main game story.

While PC CD-ROM version (as well as updated PC DVD-ROM special release) feature adult content, Dreamcast version has all the sexual content removed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Various character emotions are done in a typical manga style
Precise chop should keep her in line
The game starts in the middle of summer
This pool needs some serious renovation
The painting seems to be progressing fine

title: Pandora no Yume

description:
Again and Refrain are originally two standalone PC games from the same series, but ported to Dreamcast they were released as a single standalone game that includes both scenarios. Dreamcast platform does not have these games released as standalone.

Dousoukai 2: Again & Refrain Dreamcast game contains scenarios from these two PC games:

  • Dousoukai: Again* Dousoukai: Refrain

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to Ayu and Tasuke in front of the house
The butler will show you to your room
Reminiscing on past events with Kanako

title: Dousoukai 2: Again & Refrain

description:
Boku to, Bokura no Natsu for Dreamcast is the non-hentai version of Boku to, Bokura no Natsu PC game for Windows with additional story scenario and new CG events.

10,000 limited copies also include a special artwork book containing character illustrations.

sample_screenshots.caption: In rural places like these, buses still don't have an air-condition
There's lots of catching up to do with your childhood friends

title: Boku to, Bokura no Natsu

description: This simulation game was originally released for PlayStation as three separate games, each focusing on a single heroine. The Dreamcast version includes all three heroines: Yumi Aida, Shizuka Houjouin, and Fumio Ueno. While the PSX version supports PocketStation, the Dreamcast version uses visual memory which also uses graphical representation of the character you are interacting with, and emphasizes what is currently happening on the main screen. You can meet the girls, buy them gifts, talk to them, check the progress status, and play various mini-games. The game also includes printed stickers of all three heroines with some additional artwork as well.
title: Pocke-Kano: Yumi, Shizuka, Fumio

description: Idol Janshi wo Tsukucchaou is based on the NAOMI arcade game Idol Janshi Suchie-Pai III. However, it isn't a port. Like the arcade game, you play mahjong against various young attractive female opponents. However, there is no nudity in this home version. There are also extras added. A "Making Mode," where you can make a character and buy accessories for her, a gallery mode where you view the art CG, and a sound test to listen to the game's vocal tracks.
title: Idol Janshi o Tsukucchaō

description:
21: Two One is a visual novel adventure game originally released for PC with adult content which is then ported to Dreamcast.

Story

After losing you mother to an illness, one day you decided to become a doctor and give your best to help other people not go through the same pain and ordeal. Your name is Takuya Kirishima, and you lived up to your expectations and became a skilled surgeon who can perform any surgery without a problem. But patients still die, and you may not be able to save them all... that brings the lack of confidence in you as a doctor and makes you question your goal to become a doctor. Seri Sakaki is a young nurse, and an old childhood friend of yours who is trying to help you deal with your limitations as a human. At such time, a murder occurs at the hospital and people start suffering from an unknown strange disease. The police investigation into it has been launched which yields many suspects and mysteries, and even more questions.

Gameplay

At its core, this is a visual novel adventure which determines the course of the story based on the choices you make. However, you can also set the mood of your character to trusting, normal, or suspicious, which will also affect the course of the game (quite similar to how it was done in Blade Runner). You will also be able to check the human relation chart to see connection between characters, as well as flow chart to see how the game story branched.
title: 21: Two One

description:
The player takes a role of a young male assistant to the picture book writer who just went on a tour of Europe for an inspiration. You, on the other hand, desperately want to prove yourself in the area, but your inspiration is as dry as an empty well. So, you decide to take those three weeks of holidays to return to your hometown and give your best to come up with something solid or completely give up on wanting to become a picture book writer. Your hometown is a couple of hours from Tokyo by bullet train, though it is a rather rural area so it requires a switch to a more local train. Upon your arrival, you soon team up with Erina, an old friend of yours, and the two of you keep on exploring town, going places an meeting people. One night, walking alone in the woods, you get caught by the rain. Running to find a shelter, you stumble upon a small shrine. There, in front of your eyes, you see a flying silhouette which soon gets zapped by the thunder and falls down not far from where you are. Not sure what you saw really happened, you come outside and see a small fairy, down on the ground under the rain and with a wounded wing. You pick her up and tend to her wound. She quickly tests her fixed wings and flies away with a smile. As the morning comes, you look over town and has a sudden vision of an unknown place. Whatever happened to you granted you certain magical abilities you are not aware of.

The game takes place in your hometown which represents reality, and a fantasy Layer world. In either world you can freely move around the map and talk to various characters you run along the way. Your hometown is split into six districts and different events and characters can be seen at different time of the day (morning, noon, evening, or night). When in Layer world, whenever important advance is being made, a battle scene which takes action on a separate combat arena will occur. The battle itself is real-time and consists of you trying to throw objects or use attacks against the boss. During adventure mode, when entering certain area from the map, the gameplay will resemble that of a regular visual novel with static backgrounds and character stills over it, varying in poses to emphasize their disposition. As dialogues are often short, dialogue choices are not used, but occasional actions you can perform are offered depending on the time and location.

sample_screenshots.caption: Erina finally found you in this rain... and she doesn't look happy
A strange vision of some sort
Running into some of your old friends and acquaintances while traversing the town
Opening screen asking you if you want to create system file

title: Angel Present

description:
You wake up at the strange loud sound coming from the bathroom. You get up from the bed and go to check what it was. Duh, it was Sandia and her strange animal companion wreaking havoc. Quick flashback to a couple of days ago, as you were waiting for your father at the airport to return from a negotiation mission from a country devastated by the civil war, to your surprise, he brought someone with him. That someone was Sandia, a princess of the country he just returned from, in danger for her life. It just so happens she'll be staying with your from now on, indefinitely as it seems.

You are Kouki Akiba, a high-school student with a regular boring school life with nothing to cause your sudden elevation in blood pressure. But that's about to change when princess Sandia who recently started living with you enters the same school you are attending. But where there are problems, there are obstacles to overcome, which may over short period of time lead to something more than just friendship between Kouki and Sandia.

The game itself is similar to the majority of visual novels in terms of basic gameplay, but differs in the artwork style which sets it apart from most of them. Bonus features include unlockable BGM player and CG gallery for each of the heroines.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sandia is asking for a favor with those puppy eyes, it's hard to say no
In the kitchen with Sandia and your mom
Selecting the location to go to next

title: Miss Moonlight

description:
空を舞う翼: Blue-Sky-Blue[s] is a visual novel that originated as an adult game for PC (Windows). Nine months after its initial release, the game was ported to Dreamcast which featured new graphics and story elements, and all the adult content has been removed.

The story revolves around a young boy, Tomoya Akuragi, whose mother passed away 10 years ago, and has been living with his father since. Due to his father's change in job position, they had to move to Hokkaido where Tomoya gets involved with a bunch of students who have a passion for sky.

The game features static characters during dialogue sequences with voice-acting included. The game supports fast-forward feature at the hold of a trigger button which lets you quickly skip through the text until the choices that affect the story and hero's affection toward in-game heroines. Bonus features include fully unlocked music player and unlockable CG galleries for each of the heroines.

sample_screenshots.caption: Reminiscing one of the past events
In the city at night with Ena

title: Sora o Mau Tsubasa: Blue-Sky-Blue[s]

description: Originally released for PC (Windows) as an adult adventure game, the ports to Dreamcast and PlayStation 2 removed the adult content, included a new heroine and extended the story. You play as Ryouichi Katsuragi, a young doctor and a family physician summoned to tend to an old man living in a huge mansion on the island in Italy. Upon arriving to the island in a helicopter, the game switches to 3rd-person perspective where you can freely explore the mansion and its surroundings and interact with various characters, including the mansion maids which act as heroines in this story. During 1st-person perspective mode, the game plays like a typical visual novel where you converse with other characters which are non-animated but feature voice-acting. The player choices during dialogues affect the story and key choices branch it toward a different ending. The bonus features which are accessible from the main menu are music player and unlockable heroine gallery.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the maids welcoming you to the island

title: Elysion: Eien no Sanctuary

description:
The game revolves around a promise you made with a girl as a young boy, to meet each other when you grow older, and a secret that has been kept for all these years. While there are many heroines included, this game's premise is more that of a mystery novel than a romance. The story takes place in present time during your reunion with your childhood friends, as well as during past time during your childhood days.

The art style in this game is rather unique in comparison to typical visual novel anime art style. The background art uses somewhat a mix of a life-like re-touched images and anime drawings. While characters use voice-acting in this Dreamcast exclusive visual novel, the animation is non-existent during dialogues. The bonus content features unlockable heroine albums which can be accessed via main menu.

sample_screenshots.caption: Down by the river with Nao
Under the starry sky with Mika
Selecting the next location to visit

title: Himitsu: Yui ga Ita Natsu

description:
My Merry May is the first game in a planned (but unfinished) trilogy, originally released for Dreamcast in 2002, followed by a PlayStation 2 port later that year. The story revolves around Kyousuke Watarase (渡良瀬 恭介), a high-school student, who one day received a strange package. In that package was Reu (レゥ), an AI android in a form of a young girl who ends up living with him under pretense of being his sister.

The game plays as a typical visual novel romance which includes reading on-screen text over background art and character sprites who come in different poses and gestures, but are not animated. Key moments feature special CG artwork to emphasize certain scene and break out from a typical "character sprite over background art" presentation. Aside from main characters, all the heroines feature full voice-acting. Player's choices allow the story to branch toward one of the several different endings, some endings focusing on your relationship with a specific heroine.

sample_screenshots.caption: Running into Hitoe at the the clothes store

title: My Merry May

description:
Shokai Genteiban (初回限定版) release of Divine Love is a non-adult version of the PC (Windows) game with the same name released one year prior to Dreamcast release. Unlike the regular Dreamcast release, this version features front cover image on the white, instead of black background.

This Shokai Genteiban release of Divine Love includes:

  • D+Vine[Luv] game
  • Audio CD featuring short, long, and karaoke version of the opening theme song "Resolution of Soul" by Kotoko
title: D+Vine[Luv] (Shokai Genteiban)

description:
Mizuiro (みずいろ) was originally released as an adult visual-novel, which yielded this console port for PlayStation 2 and Dreamcast two years later. The game follows the story of Kenji Katase (片瀬 健二), a high-school student who lives with his adopted sister, Yuki (雪希). One day, Kenji's childhood friend, Hiyori Hayasaka (早坂 日和), re-appears in his life and his long-gone feelings of affection toward her started to awaken.

As is the case with many romance-driven visual novels, your choices will determine how the story branches, and your actions will drive the story toward the heroine of your interest. While this console game version removed the adult content, it added additional character and story content with new CG events. As you play through the games, you unlock CG gallery for heroines which is accessible via main menu, along with the music player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dialogue window can be toggled off to see the clear background picture
Character introduction in the opening video

title: Mizuiro

description: This budget release of Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2 includes the game along with an audio drama CD for Pia Carrot 3. This Dreamcast version of the game is based on the prior Sega Saturn version with additional censoring to reduce the age rating, and was previously only available in the Pia Carrot 2.5 collection.

sample_screenshots.caption: The story starts in the middle of summer
Opening movie showing Azusa up close
Opening movie showing summer memories on the beach

title: Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2

description:
Gundam Side Story 0079: Rise from the Ashes is a mech combat simulation set in the Gundam universe. Created to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the franchise, it presents an original story set during the One Year War between the Earth Federation and Zeon, parallel to the events of the first Gundam TV series. It takes place in Australia and stars the mobile suit team White Dingo, a guerrilla combat unit supporting the main forces of a Federation counteroffensive against the Zeonic forces.

The player controls Lt. Rayer, who along with his team mates Leung, Mike and Anita must fight Zeon in nine missions. Before each mission, briefings from Commander Hawkins and messages from the teammates are shown as FMV sequences. The squad of three mobile suits (Anita controls the OASIS hover truck) must be outfitted by choosing suits, weapons, and shields. Two suits are available from the start: RGM-79 and RGC-80, with the RGC more heavily armed and armored at the cost of reduced mobility. Further suits become available for special mission objectives later in the game. The choice of weapons includes various projectile and beam weapons, along with rocket launchers and grenades. Weapons differ in ammo (some have unlimited shots, others have magazines and thus a short reloading time), range and power.

Missions are seen from a first-person cockpit perspective, but also employ in-engine cutscenes to show plot developments. Mission objectives usually include the destruction of a specific enemy unit or structure, but goals can change mid-mission. Leung and Mike fight on their own but can also be given specific orders, including movement and search patterns, attacking specific enemies or defending friendly units. They can be given preferences for long- mid- or close-range combat. Anita's OASIS truck cannot attack or defend, but can be used to detect enemies on the map through a special radar scan. Enemies include all sorts of ground soldiers, tanks, aircraft and of course mobile suits as seen in the TV show, including Zakus, Goufs and Gelgoogs.

The player's suit is controlled via the directional pad for movement and the analog stick to look around. Double-pressing on the pad enables a quick dash via vernier thrusters. The thrusters can also be used to jump or hover, but can overheat and then require a cooldown period before becoming reusable. For ranged combat, the cockpit view can be switched to a sniping mode. Close combat against a mobile suit on the other hand automatically switches to a melee mode, in which the suits draw their beam sabers and duel it out.
title: Gundam Side Story 0079: Rise from the Ashes

description:
Reel Fishing: Wild is a Dreamcast-exclusive entry in the fishing simulation series. It allows players to catch two dozen species of fish in 14 different locations all over the world, from Japan to North and South America to Oceania. The Dreamcast fishing rod controller is supported for realistic castings and reel-ins.

The game starts in the fishing lodge, where players can check out a fish glossary, their catch list and their stock of lures, reels and lines and rods. Going for a round of fishing is done via the fishing notebook, which presents players with a series of challenges. At the start, only one location - a Japanese mountain stream - is unlocked. To unlock others, a certain number of a particular species must be caught. Catching fish not only opens up new locations, but also gives access to new types of lures, reels and lines, and rods, which in turn allow more successful fishing.

A fishing session begins with a photo-realistic first-person view of the location created through combining digitized images with some animation, like for a waterfall or swaying trees, as well as disturbances of the water surface that hint at the best places for casting. Once the line is cast and a fish moves near the lure, the view switches to a 3D underwater view, showing fish, line, and hook in close-up. Baiting, setting the hook, and reeling in the catch are then done in this view.
title: Reel Fishing: Wild

description:
NHL 2K2 is the sequel to NHL 2K and the last game in the series to appear on the Dreamcast. It is very similar to its predecessor, reusing the same graphics engine and many of the modes. There have been improvements in graphics with higher polygon counts, more animations and 60 fps frame rate. AI has also been improved, and the controls allow for many more realistic moves. Player and team stats have been updated for the 2001-2002 NHL season.

Game modes include Exhibition, Season (now optionally only of half length), Playoffs and, newly added, Tournaments. Players can be created and traded and rosters edited. Coaching controls allow setting of strategies and lines. The game includes a basic control mode that uses the face buttons for all actions, and an advanced mode that uses the trigger buttons to modify the actions of the face buttons, allowing for a higher variety of moves. The game includes play-by-play commentary by L.A. Kings announcer Bob Miller.
title: NHL 2K2

description:
Speed Devils: Online Racing is an updated version of Speed Devils that reuses the tracks and cars from the original game, adds new ones, and puts them into completely new modes with a focus on online multiplayer.

The game includes online and offline options. Offline functions as a practice mode for online, and has only two modes: Arcade (for a standard race against AI-controlled opponents) and Ghost (for a one-on-one against oneself). At the start, car selection is limited and further cars can only be unlocked by playing online.

The meat of the game is in Online mode. After customizing their online persona, players start with $10.000, enough to buy a car of the lowest class. Money must be earned by racing, enabling players to buy new cars and tune them with new parts. There are three kinds of races: Standard, Trial and Vendetta.

Standard races allow various ways of earning money, of which winning is only one: breaking speed limits at certain points and setting race records (highest speed, fastest lap time, leading the longest) also increase cash flow. Trial races involve wagering: a minimum amount is set by the race creator that all participants must pay to take part. The creator also sets between one and four challenges from a pool of 22 possible options. These include similar records as in the Standard races, but also challenges to always (or never) break the speed limit, bust the limit (but never twice on the same radar), get best times on specific laps, always improve times from lap to lap or not take any damage. The wagered money is distributed at the end of the race between all participants that completed their challenges, taking into account the difficulty of the challenge and the final positions of the racers. Vendetta races are always one-on-one, with the winner taking the loser's car.

The game includes all the tracks from the first game (7 unique tracks in 12 configurations), adds a "Heavy Winter" configuration to the Canada track and adds one new track (Montreal) with three configurations, for a total of 16 different tracks, all of which can be raced in reverse or mirrored, and with weather and time of day selectable. The number of cars has been doubled from the original, adding an additional eleven.
title: Speed Devils: Online Racing

description:
Medical Box is a special limited release of Candy Stripe: Minarai Tenshi which comes packed in a specially designed medical box with approximate dimensions of: 20cm wide, 17cm long, and 8cm tall. All the content inside the box, including box itself, feature artwork displaying heroines from the game.

The contents of the plastic medical box include:

  • Candy Stripe: Minarai Tenshi game in jewel case
  • medical chart holder
  • bandage
  • 7-day pill box
  • medical envelope (similar to the one you get in apothecary with the pills)
  • mobile phone charm
  • pen with a glowing tip surround which lets you write in dark
  • memo pad
title: Candy Stripe: Minarai Tenshi (Medical Box)

description:
D+Vine[Luv] (pronounced Divine Love) is a typical J-RPG, using a top-down perspective with a slightly isometric representation, which also utilizes visual novel segments for adventure elements. The player takes control of Hyde, an adventurous lad who has a knack for exploring dungeons in search of relics from the old world. One day, he arrives at the town called Arvil where he hears a rumor about a nearby unexplored cave. He heads there determined to find new relics, not minding the fact that noone's been there in ages and the place is probably infested with monsters. To his surprise, he doesn't discover and relic or a treasure, but instead, a mysterious girl named Yura. She has apparently lost her memory and can't remember anything but her name.

Unlike the original PC (Windows) version released almost two years earlier, the Dreamcast port does not feature any adult content. A couple of years later, DVD PG Edition release came out which also includes adult content.
title: D+Vine[Luv]

description: It's March, and Yuu Nakagaki (中垣 祐) just graduated from junior high-school and is heading to a remote countryside to visit his aunt. This spring really wasn't in Yuu's favor, both in his school and love life... he failed to take an exam and he ended up with a broken heart. So this spring he ended up at his aunt's place and got a part-time job to manage the hot springs hotel called Harusame (春雨), Japanese for Spring Rain. Without a reason to object and looking forward to something that will take his mind off his recent events, in this small hot springs town surrounded by the sea and the mountains, his story begins. This visual novel uses text over entire dimmed background and features multiple choices during dialogues. Additionally, an area map lets you travel between locations.
title: Harusameyoubi

description:
This First Print Limited Edition release includes:

  • 21: Two One game
  • Desktop calendar for year 2002
title: 21: Two One (Shokai Genteiban)

description:
E.O.S.: Exhibition of Speed is a racing game with over twenty fictional cars to choose from and a total of fifteen racecourses that differ in weather conditions.

The game offers several modes like: trophy, quick race, time trial, online and a multiplayer mode for up to four players. When playing different drivers and cars with different characteristics can be selected. Additional cars can be unlocked during play.
title: E.O.S.: Exhibition of Speed

description: Roommate Novel: Yuka Sato (ルームメイトノベル 〜佐藤由香〜) is a standalone visual novel not related to previously released Roommate games which focused on Inoue Ryoko heroine, developed by the same company. Unlike in previous games, this game emphasizes word "novel" in its title by having the game play resemble that of a visual novel without built-in clock and time progress as in previous titles. Heroine in this story is Yuka Satou (佐藤 由香) which one day suddenly appears on your doorstep. You returned to your hometown from Tokyo for the summer, and you end up sharing a place with Yuka during the holidays. The text screen with player choices appears over the entire image instead of a dialogue window, and choices made by the player will lead to one of multiple endings.
title: Roommate Novel: Yuka Sato

description: Love Hina: Totsuzen no Engage Happening is an adventure game based on the Love Hina anime. It still revolves around Keitaro managing a house full of girls while trying to study for an entrance exam to a university he set his mind on some time ago. Naturally, distractions are plentiful and he will have his hands full. The game features original story from the franchise, and plays as an adventure visual novel with a rather original gameplay system. While you control your character through an isometric perspective, and talk to characters in a visual novel style by displaying their portraits over current background with full voice-overs for heroines during dialogues, dialogue and action choices are replaced with a command roulette system which requires good reflexes to select the wanted outcome.
title: Love Hina: Totsuzen no Engage Happening

description: The Dreamcast version of Railroad Tycoon II includes scenarios from the Windows version of Railroad Tycoon II and Railroad Tycoon II: The Second Century, as well as a set of entirely new and exclusive scenarios and a 3D engine.
title: Railroad Tycoon II: Gold Edition

description:
July is a mystery adventure game that follows the story of two young men, Makoto Tanimura (19-year old) and Joshua (29-year old) who set on a quest to uncover the mystery behind a bombing that took place several years ago. The story of the two play separately in their own chapters and can be progressed in any order, one chapter at the time. While their stories start separately, their paths cross when they uncover the truth behind the bombing and how it all ties to a secret corporation known as NAX.

July is more of a visual novel where player advances through dialogues and choices, and travels to different locations, than typical adventure with clickable objects and inventory items. The map is a big part of interface and chooses many locations that player can visit as events are triggered by visiting the right place at the right time. The game uses anime style character art with pre-rendered backgrounds and occasional pre-rendered animated cut-scenes. There is no voice-acting, however, neither for player characters nor for NPCs.
title: July

description:
Yoshia no Oka de Nekoronde... for Dreamcast is a non-adult port of a PC (Windows) adult visual novel with the same name that was released only four months earlier. Aside from obviously removed adult content, there are several other noticeable changes in this console version release.

In comparison to PC version these things are worth mentioning:

  • There are some adjustments in the scenario and ending
  • The ported art is of same quality but does not go beyond erotic in content
  • Console version features full voice-acting for the characters
title: Yoshia no Oka de Nekoronde...

description:
Happy Lesson is a visual novel adventure game based on the manga with the same name which also spanned anime TV series. The story follows a young orphan who ends up living with five female teachers who in turn try to be a mother figure to him as well as to teach him various subjects and prepare him to be a good student endowed with knowledge.

During the location selection, player can choose to go to school, to town, or back home, and to a specific location at each of the places, such as to go a a school's pool area, or to school's roof, or when in town to go to the beach, downtown, etc. and finally, at his own place the selection of rooms are available such as living room, kitchen, or bedroom. Throughout the course of the day several locations can be visited, and each will trigger a different CG event scene and possible conversation with one of your teachers.

Bonus features which can be accessed via main menu include unlockable CG gallery and special Dreamcast Internet page access with additional game-related content for more fun.
title: Happy★Lesson

description:
This first print limited edition release includes:

  • Renai Chu!: Kanojo no Himitsu wa Otoko no Ko? - Happy Perfect game
  • Bonus CD with 7 audio tracks, 2 MPEG videos, and BMP wallpapers
  • Metal bookmark
  • Love letter
  • 2004 calendar
  • 6 postcards
title: Renai Chu!: Kanojo no Himitsu wa Otoko no Ko? - Happy Perfect (Shokai Genteiban)

description:
This special edition release includes:

  • Shirotsume Souwa: Episode of the Clovers game
  • A set of cards
  • A black card pouch
title: Shirotsume Souwa: Episode of the Clovers (Shokai Genteiban)

description:
This limited edition release includes:

  • Yume no Tsubasa: Fate of Heart game
  • Memories Off 2nd promotion disc

Memories Off 2nd promotion disc contains unique Trial Story not available in the Memories Off 2nd game, and a bonus event CG gallery.
title: Yume no Tsubasa: Fate of Heart (Genteiban)

description:
Culdcept Second is a board/card game mix and a sequel to Culdcept game for Sega Saturn. This game also got ported for PlayStation 2 platform under title Culdcept II: Expansion which added more cards, more maps, and new game modes. This sequel features revamped game system, graphics, and music from previous works. It is also the first game in the series with network support which allows for upload and download of various game data.

The board is presented isometrically in a bird's eye view perspective with characters and creatures moving on it with the roll of a dice, while using spells and cards during attacks. Each card with a creature holds various info, such as creature's strength and health, weaknesses, items, and card strength, which determine the outcome of a combat. The story mode consists of many level boards you need to conquer as you travel the world map. The board contains different terrain types, structures, and player and AI units which fight for supremacy. Units can also be upgraded which increases the overall strength of that creature.

The game also supports 1-4 player battles over network. Story mode gameplay can also be recorded and uploaded to network for other players to download and see as a replay.
title: Culdcept II

alternate_titles.title: Golf Shiyouyo: Courses Data - Adventure Edition

description:
This Courses Data disc is an append disc for Golf Shiyou yo (known as Tee Off in the west) which adds five new courses. This append disc adds two playable modes: Free Round and Club House Express.

Free Round mode includes these games:

  • Point Tourney
    Supports 1-4 players and focuses on a single hole. Points are awarded in this order: 5 (for Albatross), 4 (for Eagle), 3 (for Birdie), 2 (for Par), 1 (for Bogey), and 0 (for Double Bogey or less)

  • Stroke Play
    Supports 1-4 players and focuses on an 18 hole course. Number of playable characters and characters themselves are selected before choosing a course from the world globe map screen.

  • Match Play
    Supports 1-4 players and has several different sub-modes to choose from, namely Single, Four Sume, Three Sume, Four Ball, Best Ball 1VS2, and Best Ball 1VS3.

Five new courses included in this append disc are: Fiji course, Nepal course, Egypt course, Mexico course, and Canada course.
title: Golf Shiyōyo: Course Data Shū - Adventure Hen

description:
This special edition of Alice Dreams Tournament comes in a cardboard slipcase and includes a second CD with the following contents:

  • A "Retro" version of Alice Dreams Tournament: This version includes 12 animated maps resembling the graphical style of consoles from 1960 - 1995, but only contains the "Bodygard", "Multikill", "Battle" and "Assault" game modes.
  • A demo of the (unfinished) side-scrolling platformer Alice Dreams.
  • A Making-Of video in MP4 format.

The second CD is bootable and allows to select between the two games, the video has to be watched on another device.
title: Alice Dreams Tournament (Collector Edition)

description:
This Dreamcast-exclusive compilation was bundled with a book documenting Yu Suzuki-designed arcade games. It includes:

  • After Burner II
  • Hang-On
  • OutRun
  • Power Drift
  • Space Harrier
title: Yu Suzuki Game Works: Vol. 1

description: Sakura Taisen Online: Teito no Yuugana Hibi is a compilation of mini-games, taken from the Sakura Wars series, that can be played online. The game content is largely the same as Sakura Taisen Online: Paris no Nagai Hibi, but this version has the Japanese cast of characters from Sakura Taisen and Sakura Taisen 2.
title: Sakura Taisen Online: Teito no Yuugana Hibi

description: Sakura Taisen-themed table games and mini-games which can be played online with other players.
title: Sakura Taisen Online: Paris no Nagai Hibi

description:
Following along from the first game, Hanagumi Taisen Columns 2 features a few refinements to the gameplay formula. The biggest change is the introduction of a battle mode selection system, allowing the player to choose one of four different styles to alter their character's gameplay. Forest is a balanced style which behaves like the rules of the previous game, with the player able to store up to three levels of super meter; Wind limits the player to only two levels of meter, but fills the meter more quickly; Mountain starts the player off with additional meter at the penalty of filling meter more slowly; and Fire allows the player to fill their meter to 4 but limits the maximum level of defensive attack to 2. Two additional modes are unlockable after completing certain story modes: Shadow, which starts with the player's meter completely full but with a major penalty to refilling it; and Lightning, which allows the player to fill their attack meter to 4 and grants a major boost to the speed at which they fill it, but prevents the player from using any defensive options at all.

The visual novel story mode follows a similar plot to the first game, but this time focuses on a production of Shonen Red vs. Benitokage with the characters competing for the role of Shonen Red. An extra unlockable story mode becomes available once the player has unlocked the four secret characters and focuses on them specifically.
title: Hanagumi Taisen Columns 2

description: The limited edition of Real Sound bundles the game with a braille instruction manual and D-2 Shock, a one-disc demo of the then-upcoming horror game D-2.
title: Real Sound: Kaze no Regret (Limited Edition)

alternate_titles.title: JoJo no Kimyō na Bōken: Mirai e no Isan

description:
A compilation of:

  • JoJo's Venture
  • JoJo's Bizarre Adventure

Being ports of arcade games to a console, some additional game modes were added which include a versus, training, and a challenge mode.

Options include being able to select eight difficulty levels, the number of rounds, the amount of damage done, having a time limit or not, and how much the SC gauge is filled at the start. Also an easy mode can be turned on or off. This mode lets player's perform special moves with a simple button press.
title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure

description:
This Shokai Genteiban Puru Puru Pack Fuzoku Set includes:

  • Sakura Taisen 2: Kimi, Shinitamou Koto Nakare
  • Vibration Pack
  • Poster
  • Sakura Taisen 3: Les Chattes Noires preview disc
title: Sakura Taisen 2: Kimi, Shinitamou Koto Nakare (Shokai Genteiban Puru Puru Pack Fuzoku Set)

description:
This Shokai Genteiban Juusan Bunki Strap Fuzoku Set includes:

  • Sakura Taisen 4: Koi seyo Otome
  • Wrist strap
  • 16 keychains
title: Sakura Taisen 4: Koi seyo Otome (Shokai Genteiban Juusan Bunki Strap Fuzoku Set)

description:
This Shokai Genteiban B Keitai Kinematron-sei Visual Memory Edition includes:

  • Sakura Taisen 3: Paris wa Moeteiru ka
  • Visual Memory Unit
title: Sakura Taisen 3: Paris wa Moeteiru ka (Shokai Genteiban B Keitai Kinematron-sei Visual Memory Edition)

description: This puzzle simulation tasks players with running a demolition crew. In each stage, players are given a set number of charges and can then navigate through a 3D floor plan, setting charges wherever they want. After setting their charges, the game simulates the building's collapse and players are scored based on how successful their job was. If players do well enough, they can move on to the next stage, but if they do badly enough their botched demolition might just make the evening news.
title: Bomber Hehhe!

description:
This Japan exclusive collector's edition of Skies of Arcadia comes in a large book-shaped folding box surrounded by a slipcase and includes:

  • the game
  • a pirate bandanna
  • three key chains with creatures from the game: Looper, a yellow Hamachou and Cupil
  • an Eternal Arcadia branded phone strap
  • a leather wristband with the Blue Rogues' logo (metal)
  • an art book (64 pages, A4)
title: Eternal Arcadia (Limited Box)

description:
This Limited Edition release contains:

  • Gundam Side Story 0079: Rise from the Ashes
  • Collectible card
title: Gundam Side Story 0079: Rise from the Ashes (Shokai Genteiban)

description:
Arcade Racing Legends is a homebrew arcade racing game, developed as a reminiscene of many classical SEGA games such as Crazy Taxi, Outrun or SEGA Rally - therefore a lot of cars and tracks pick up elements from those games. In total there are 7 different tracks, ranging from Desert tracks over an underwater course to a neon-colored city at night, and 24 different cars.

The game features several game modes: A "Career" mode with 18 different tasks (beating a given time, not touching the banks, or winning a race against computer opponents), an "Arcade" mode to just race against other AI players and a "Time Trial" mode to beat the best time and race against a ghost. The game also supports splitscreen multiplayer (called "Duel") for two players. New tracks in Arcade mode have to be unlocked by finishing the previous track first place against the CPU.
title: Arcade Racing Legends

description:
This Limited Edition comes in a double jewel case, wrapped in a red plastic slipcase. It includes:

  • The Textorcist: The Story of Ray Bibbia (game disc)
  • Manual
  • Soundtrack (audio disc)
title: The Textorcist: The Story of Ray Bibbia (Limited to 666)

description: In Bokomu no Tatsujin, you play as 19 year old college student Kenta, playing various mini-games in which you meet people and perform odd jobs around town. The visual style varies from stylized 2D art to full 3D environments depending on the activity.
title: Bokomu no Tatsujin

description:
Frame Gride is a mech-based one-on-one fighting game played from a behind, over-the-shoulder view. It also contains missions and RPG elements that link the fights together. Attacks are based on both weapons and hack-and-slash swordplay. The mech can also strafe, jump and fly for a short while.

The rebellion of Margrave Zort, which began with the death of Emperor Regilio, engulfed an entire empire into a flaming epic war. Five armor giant electors have already been brutally defeated. Archbishop Mirange, the last remaining elector grants the title of knight to a young man. This young man is entrusted with hope as he must defeat the rebel army by piloting the armor giant "Frame Gride" utilizing an ancient power that has been passed down from ancient times.
title: Frame Gride

description:
Golf Shiyouyo 2: Aratanaru Chōsen is the sequel to Golf Shiyou yo. It adds a variety of new characters and improved functionality.

Play golf with up to four-players and choose between a World Tour mode, Free Round mode (Stroke Play, Match Play, Point Tourney, and Time Attack) and ranking tournaments. Improve your golf game by exchanging GP (Golf Shiyouyo points) for new golf clubs, balls and costumes, many of which are based on actual items made by Bridgestone Corporation in Japan. GP can also be accumulated by playing slot machines or blackjack.

Players can choose between courses around the world ranging from Japan, Hawaii, Sweden, Brazil, Zimbabwe, England or America. This edition adds online multiplayer compatible only with the dial-up modem. The online functionality for this edition in Japan existed from January 25, 2001 and ended on August 20, 2001.
title: Golf Shiyōyo 2: Aratanaru Chōsen

description:
Gundam Battle Online is a game based on Mobile Suit Gundam. The player can choose between being a commander of the federal army or the Zeon army. They can form an original fleet and give orders to mobile suits and battleships in combat. 4 players can play simultaneously on the internet via online play mode. It is necessary to purchase a Gundam Battle License to play online in Japan. The game is not compatible with the Broadband Adapter.

As a commander, you can direct your battleships and mobile suits to lead your army to victory. Create your own original unit with four types of pilots under your command: shooting, hand-to-hand combat, snipers, and anti-identification type. Choose between two modes: "Map mode" which moves the fleet forward and "Battle Mode" in which battleships and mobile suits engage in combat.

If you choose offline standalone mode you can play in a tactical simulation that takes place in semi-real time on a hex-separated map. When the player unit and the enemy unit edge closer to one another they can then engage in combat.
title: Gundam Battle Online

description: Zusar Vasar is a futuristic racing game. In 2300 AD humanity is devastated by natural disasters. Some members of humanity have withstood the destruction above ground, while those that moved underground would go on to lead pathetic lives controlled by a tyrannical government. As the years go by, humanity has forgotten about the devastation of nature above, and soon a war breaks out between survivors underground and those that have survived above-ground. Mechanical animals named "DOUBLE STEED" have been developed that transport armored vehicles known as "STEELS LEDGE". The under and above ground survivors battle it out in violent races with these new forms of transport.
title: Zusar Vasar

description:
Vermilion Desert is a real-time strategy game with RPG elements. The player plans missions based on battlefield information in real-time using a map. Each unit acts automatically according to skills, situations, and directions. The player also controls a power suit unit and is creating a variety of team strategies with detailed settings, such as the range of weapons and different formations.

The Silver Fox special forces are fighting against an aggressor who's invading the kingdom of Argan. Besides destroying the enemy, there are also operations like "hostage rescue", "infiltration" and "retreat operations".
title: Vermilion Desert

description:
Based on the classic manga Blue Submarine No. 6 and its anime adaptations, this post-apocalyptic naval adventure game has players heading up an undersea salvage crew. In its adventure mode, players interact with other players using menu-driven exploration and dialogue. When they step into the sub, players take to the ocean floor in a first-person 3D simulation where they must salvage parts from crashed ships and other things they can find undersea.

The adventure mode features a mix of 2D backgrounds with highly detailed polygonal characters, while key story scenes are told in animated cutscenes provided by Gonzo, the same studio that animated the 1998-2000 OVA series.
title: Blue Submarine No. 6: Saigetsu Fumahito - Time and Tide

description: Sonic Adventure: Oshōgatsu is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure, exclusively in Japan from December 26, 1998 to January 7, 1999. In commemoration of New Year's, kadomatsu, or New Year's pine decorations, are placed throughout Station Square. Interacting with a kadomatsu gives a New Year's message, with each one having a unique message, and changes the background music to one of three traditional Japanese-style music tracks.
title: Sonic Adventure: Oshōgatsu

description:
This compilation contains the following four Astro Port shoot-em-ups:

  • Gigantic Army
  • Satazius Next (also including the original Satazius)
  • Wolflame
  • Zangeki Warp

This compilation is the first release of Gigantic Army and Zangeki Warp for Dreamcast.
title: Astro Port Collector

description: Sonic Adventure: XMAS is Christmas-themed event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure, released only in Japan and downloadable only from the base game's release on December 23, 1998 to December 25, 1998. Six Christmas trees are added to various locations in Station Square. Interacting with them gives a Christmas greeting and changes the background music to one of three instrumentals of Christmas carols: "Jingle Bells," "Joy to the World" or "Silent Night."
title: Sonic Adventure: XMAS

description: Sonic Adventure: QUO is event data could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure, exclusively in Japan. Meant to tie in with a real-world contest, this data adds what is essentially a mini-game, activated by jumping into a floating red balloon above the steps to SS Central Station. Six QUO cards featuring Hidekazu Yukawa are hidden in Station Square and the Mystic Ruins, and the player must locate them all within a ten minute time limit. The player would then have to jump into a floating blue balloon over the steps of the Mystic Ruins train station to mark the mission complete.
title: Sonic Adventure: QUO

description: Sonic Adventure: Famitsu is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure, exclusively in Japan. Meant to tie in with a real-world contest, this data adds what is essentially a mini-game, activated by jumping into a floating red balloon in front of SS Central Station. Five photographs of real hedgehogs are placed throughout Station Square, and the player must find all of them within a ten minute time limit. Once finding them all, you must finish the hunt by jumping into the floating blue balloon inside SS Central Station.
title: Sonic Adventure: Famitsu

description: Dreamcast Launch Party is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure, and the first such event available worldwide. It celebrates the international launch of the Dreamcast. Large banners with the Dreamcast logo and bunches of balloons with the Dreamcast symbol are placed throughout Station Square. Touching each gives a line of text, either teasing the future of the Dreamcast or thanking the player for supporting SEGA and Sonic Team.
title: Sonic Adventure: Dreamcast Launch Party

description: Tremble Park is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure, commemorating Halloween. Posters reading "Happy Halloween" are plastered all over Station Square, with a large mat on the ground in front of Twinkle Park's entrance with the same design. Stepping on it tells the player a Halloween party is being held there. Twinkle Park has large "trick or treat" graffiti messages spray-painted all over the place, and ghosts float around, which also say "Trick or Treat!" when touched. While generally harmless, ghosts on the bowling lanes will stop the player if they run into them.
title: Sonic Adventure: Tremble Park

description: Sonic Adventure: Sonic2k - Assault on Speed Highway is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure. Meant to tie in with a real-world contest that was only available in the United States, it was only available from October 29, 1999 to November 19, 1999, and it adds a new mission for Sonic. Signs advertising the Dreamcast and AT&T are added to the Cyber-Net Inc. building in Station Square, as well as a START plate in front of it that, when jumped into, brings the player to Speed Highway, and a timer starts, with a goal of five minutes. Only the first part of the Action Stage is playable from here, and it is now decorated with AT&T billboards, as well as special round platform lights advertising the phone provider, some of which can be jumped onto as shortcuts. The player must reach the goal at the end of the area, then, when back in Station Square, they must jump into the plate again, now marked "GOAL!" The player's time is then recorded and the progress is saved.
title: Sonic Adventure: Sonic2k - Assault on Speed Highway

description: Sonic Adventure: Sonic2k - Treasure Hunt is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure. Meant to tie in with a real-world contest that was only available in the United States, it was only available from November 26, 1999 to December 17, 1999, and it adds a new mission for Knuckles. Two Dreamcast/AT&T signs, one in front of SS Central Station and the other in the grass next to the Cyber-Net Inc. building, tell the player to head to the Mystic Ruins. Once there, touching the "START" plate on the train platform begins a timer, set for five minutes, and the player must start digging in the immediate area to search for treasure, while signs scattered around give hints to the treasure's location. Once four treasures are found, the player must touch the "FINISH!" plate on the other side of the train platform to record their time and save the game.
title: Sonic Adventure: Sonic2k - Treasure Hunt

description: Sonic Adventure: Sonic 2k - Tails in Sand Hill Attack is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure. Meant to tie in with a real-world contest that was only available in the United States, it was only available from December 24, 1999 to January 7, 2000, and it adds a new mission for Tails. AT&T ads appear in Station Square in front of SS Central Station telling the player to head to Sand Hill.
