Once the Sub Game is started, the player must pass through the giant "START" plate to begin the challenge, at which point a three minute timer starts. In addition to Dreamcast/AT&T billboards being added to Sand Hill, ten specially-marked blue AT&T gates are added, and the player must pass through each of them. If all the blue gates are passed through, the player must pass through the giant "GOAL!" plate at the end of the course to record their time and save the game.
title: Sonic Adventure: Sonic 2k - Tails in Sand Hill Attack

description: European Sonic Speed Challenge is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure. Meant to tie in with a real-world contest that was only available in Europe, it was only available from December 1, 1999 to January 14, 2000, and it adds a new mission for Sonic. Reebok DMX signs are added to the front of the Station Square Hotel, as well as floating in the Hotel's pool area. Touching them announces that the Reebok DMX Speed Challenge is open at Emerald Coast. A "START" plate floats in front of the entrance to Emerald Coast, and touching it sets a timer for ten minutes and transports the player to the Action Stage, beginning the Challenge. Only the first part of Emerald Coast is playable from here, and posters for Reebok are added to the Stage. In addition, Reebok DMX shoes themselves can be floating inside Eggman capsules in various locations, five pairs, in both plain sight and hidden, and each must be collected. If the player collects all the shoes and touches the "GOAL!" plate floating at the end of the first part of the Stage, their time is recorded and the player must manually exit the Stage.
title: Sonic Adventure: European Sonic Speed Challenge

description: Sonic Adventure: Christmas is event data that could be downloaded to the player's VMU for use in Sonic Adventure. Not to be confused with the Japan-exclusive Christmas download from the previous year, this one was available worldwide. Four very large Christmas trees have been added various areas in Station Square, each one giving the player a unique Christmas greeting, and the background music is changed to "Dreams Dreams" A Cappella Version from Christmas NiGHTS into Dreams....
title: Sonic Adventure: Christmas

description: Replicating the physical trading card game of the same name, Magic: The Gathering takes place on the plane of Celesta, in the town of Magic Heart and its surrounding areas. The player wanders the lands dueling against computer controlled opponents unlocking new cards in the progress. The areas you can enter represent a type of basic mana that influences the spells included in your opponents deck, areas such as; Murg, Camat Island, Lydar Fores Yeluk and Tornell . After finishing those you get access to the final area, the Balance Tower where you face three boss fights in succession. The game includes cards from the Sixth Edition core set, plus cards from the Alliances and Tempest expansions. Additionally, the game also adds ten brand new cards, that include random elements and mechanics not possible in the paper game.
title: Magic: The Gathering

description:
Plus Plumb is a puzzle game where you connect 3 stones of the same color to erase them as they fall from above.

Stones fall onto your game board from above, each in one of six colors. As they fall, you may change their color: between red and blue, yellow and green, and white and purple. The player must drop a stone such that three or more of the same color are touching, causing them to disappear and stones above fall into their place.

As the stones collect at the platform on the bottom of the board, their weight lowers the platform towards the bottom of the screen. The aim of the game is to beat the opponent who plays with a similar game board filling up with stones, with the game ending once either your or your opponents platform falls to the ground. As you erase stones from your board, special combinations of stones and colors allows you to further burden the opponent's platform.
title: Plus Plumb

description: This Dreamcast conversion of Kaitō Apricot includes all content from the original PC release, along with new events and romantic endings for three characters who were previously only side characters: Nozomu Ayase, Mitsuru Mizushima, and Sō Mochizuki.
title: Kaitō Apricot

description: Shin Honkaku Hanafuda is a collection of Japanese hanafuda card games, and a follow-up to Honkaku Hanafuda. It includes four different games: returning from the previous release are the two-player games Koi-Koi, Hana-Awase, and Oicho-Kabu; new in this release is the three-player game Hachi-Hachi. The main game mode is a tournament mode where the player must defeat a series of opponents at each of the games. There is also a free play mode where any game can be selected and played against the computer.
title: Shin Honkaku Hanafuda

description:
This collection includes updated ports of two games in the Pia Carrot series:

  • Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2, a conversion based on the previous Sega Saturn version of the game with minor content changes to lower the age rating. This version was also later released separately.
  • Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2.2, a remake of the previous Game Boy Color version with updated graphics and full voice acting. This version was only available in this package.
title: Pia Carrot e Yōkoso!! 2.5
